column5: Bass and Pike report.. Last weekend I went out for some bass and pike but I just couldn't get them to bite had a couple of small bites so I down sized and started getting big jumbo perch one had a live minnow in it's mouth so I used it for bait, the thing would barely hit the water and they were all over it, till I lost it I had a small 2' plastic minnow on a small jig and again they were slamming it. A couple of them were not able to release so I figured I would keep a meal of them.. so today I woke up and the wind was down,,even thought the weather reports called for high winds I grabbed my new underwater camera ( the aquava fish camera died the rest of the unit was fine) so I got a different kind of camera and MacGyvered it to work with the aqua vu I went back to the same spot as last weekend and they were on again not the big jumbos, but still jumbos or close to them the HDS 5 was marking lots of fish here are some here are some videos

Those perch look like easy pickings for a pike. I'm suprised you didn't see a pike after all that commotion in the water.  If there was a tv channel dedicated to underwater fish cameras I would watch it 24/7
that definitely looks like fun... just wished I have a boat.
Nice yellows bud. Better then where I was today.Yep work.
Good job Terry.  Almost makes me wish I was ice fishing     Okay, not yet but soon  Joey
Thanks for the report Terry. i will be out on cooks bay Sunday afternoon(tomorrow) looking for pike and perch
aqua vu??  i thought you had a marcum camera ?

21 ft was where I found the bigger perch  but pike were not nice to me this weekend   yeah I do have a marcum which replaced the broken aqua uv   I saw a good deal on ebay for just a camera and wanted to see if it would work  so now I guess I have 2  one for each hole   ice fishing hole that is
Great report.Perch are great to eat. I just hate cleaning them! Great vids too. Thanks for sharing.
Great report Terry, love the underwater stuff....MORE PLEASE!!!!

well I have about 3 hours from saturday   <object width="480" height="385"><param name="movie" value="http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iIVuJrpMwNM?fs=1&hl=en_US"></param><param'>http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iIVuJrpMwNM?fs=1&hl=en_US"></param><param name="allowFullScreen" value="true"></param><param name="allowscriptaccess" value="always"></param><embed src="http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iIVuJrpMwNM?fs=1&hl=en_US" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" allowscriptaccess="always" allowfullscreen="true" width="480" height="385"></embed></object>
we were down at the barrie waterfront for a hr or two this afternoon.  plenty of dinks, nothing worth keeping.  too bad, i was hoping for a feed. mmmmmmmmm
We were just down there this evening. I kept 6 and fed the seagulls a bunch of gobies. Nothing real big but we'll get one good meal for two from the 6 fish.
